title: Amid strong rookie year, Will Campbell has little to say to doubters
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots "I'm really not worried about what anybody else has to say.
” Will Campbell has been a steadying force on the offensive line for New England.
(AP Photo/Charles Krupa) FOXBOROUGH — Will Campbell has heard all of the nicknames and criticism from naysayers at this point.

title: 8 students injured when school bus crashes in Weston
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Local News The injured students had minor injuries and were taken to a local hospital to be evaluated, according to officials.
By Darin Zullo October 22, 2025 Less than a minute to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.
Eight students were hospitalized after a school bus crashed Wednesday afternoon on Route 128 South in Weston, fire officials said.

title: Charlton woman sentenced for raping foster child in 2015
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Crime The 52-year-old woman raped her 12-year-old victim in 2015 while acting as their foster parent, according to prosecutors.
A Charlton woman was sentenced to a decade in prison Tuesday for raping a 12-year-old child, prosecutors announced.
Heather Wright-Craft, 52, was found guilty Sept.

title: Charges dismissed against man accused of vandalizing Teslas with anti-Musk stickers in Brookline
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Local News Several Tesla drivers reported acts of vandalism prior to the man’s arrest, including one driver who sent in a video of their confrontation.
A Roslindale man accused of vandalizing several Tesla vehicles has had his charges dropped.

Brent Lewin/Bloomberg By Darin Zullo October 22, 2025 | 7:51 PM 1 minute to read A Brookline judge dismissed charges last week against a Roslindale man who was arrested earlier this year for allegedly vandalizing Tesla vehicles in Brookline, court records show.

title: Wyc Grousbeck says Jayson Tatum not expected to play this season
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Celtics "We’re assuming he’s not coming back, and we’re not even going to have any discussions about it.
" Jayson Tatum still has a long road to recovery.

(AP Photo/Charles Krupa) By Conor Ryan October 22, 2025 | 7:41 PM 2 minutes to read Jayson Tatum has not ruled anything out when it comes to potentially returning to the court at some point during the 2025-26 season.

title: Kristaps Porzingis reveals what illness derailed his final season with the Celtics
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Celtics “At that time, I could just lay on the couch and be a house cat.
” Kristaps Porzingis is looking for a clean slate in Atlanta.

(AP Photo/Mike Stewart) By Conor Ryan October 22, 2025 | 7:11 PM 2 minutes to read Kristaps Porzingis’ arrival prior to the 2023-24 season played a key role in the Celtics’ run to a sought-after 18th championship.

title: Ex-WBZ anchor Kate Merrill drops claims against one Black colleague in discrimination lawsuit
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Local News The two colleagues initially named as defendants had filed complaints against Merrill, she said, accusing her of making racist remarks.
One is no longer named as a defendant.
Former WBZ anchor Kate Merrill.

title: State’s second-largest health insurance company announces 250+ layoffs
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Business Harvard Pilgrim Health Care and Tufts Health Plan's parent company cites rising medical and pharmaceutical costs as the reason for the cuts.
FILE — An empty cubicle in Brooklyn, New York, on May 15, 2020.
Gabriela Bhaskar/The New York Times Point32Health announced it is laying off 254 employees on Monday, its second round of reductions this year.
